MECHANICS:  No check engine lights on HOWEVER there is a low pressure situation most likely a vacuum leak you can hear it and due to the low pressure the car only has very little power the reason it won’t pass smog.    
COSMETIC:  This car has been the victim of a lot of random vandalism which has caused many cosmetic problems.  The biggest was a slashing to the convertible top which has been sealed and watertight.  There are lots of details to work on at your own leisure.

title: MGB GT Coupe Hatchback 1972 Sweet Little Car, Runs Good!
description:
QR Code Link to This Post


This is a sweet little 1972 MGB GT hatchback, 4 speed. These British cars are amazing. Haven't had it for long, no problems so far and drove it around the city and to the East Bay plenty of times. The guy I got it from is a mechanic and installed a new slave cylinder and gave it a general work-over. Body is pretty great save for a nasty spot below driver's side door. Interior isn't bad either, carpeting in good shape, MG mudrugs, original tan upholstery. Salvage title though I've been told the car wasn't in an accident (and priced accordingly). Unclear whether odometer rolled over, but from what I know it was just a little town car in Concord for most of its life. The clutch needs some attention (probably just a thorough bleeding), as well as some dash electrical. 

Thought I had time for a little toy, classic car- but life changed and I got laid off and have some new priorities. Looking to place it in the hands of someone who can appreciate it and give it the TLC and time to really cherry it out!

No low ballers but serious offers entertained, contact me for a test drive, hoping to pass this beauty along sooner rather than later. Happy to use my Triple A towing to get it to you as well. I'm in the Outer Sunset of SF, by the beach. $6000 or best offer, VERY motivated to sell, payment by cash or Zelle preferred. Not interested in trades.

title: 2007 Audi A3 Premium Plus with 144K great city car to park anywhere
description:
QR Code Link to This Post


For sale is my 2007 Audi A3 Premium Plus with 144K miles. While this is not a show car example, this is one of the more reliable and most fun vehicles I have ever driven. Very peppy off the line, and always ready to give more. Turbo spools with ease, and transmission shifts like butter.

Some features/maintenance:

- Low miles: 144K
- Color: Ice silver metallic with black leather interior.
- Premium Plus package (includes Bluetooth phone interface) 
- Sport steering with paddle shifters and controller (track/volume/voice control/paddle shifters)
- Open-sky sunroof 
- Factory Xenon headlights that moves angle with the steering wheel (giving maximum visibility)
- Factory Bluetooth
- Trip computer (shows MPGs, speed, temp, and other info)
- 6-speed automatic DSG transmission
- Recently replaced Cam follower (Cam Camshaft Follower for VW Audi 2.0T FSI 06D109309C)
    This is truly a maintenance item for the FSI engine and always neglected. Always look at this if looking at any other 2006-2009 FSI VW/Audi engines)
- Recently replaced timing belt with all pulleys and bolts (@99K miles)
- Reverse camera 
- Programmed to open windows via remote (best feature in summer)
- New upgraded driver airbag from Audi last year (recent recall)
- Master window switch replaced 
- All new red top (Audi R8) coils with new NGK spark plugs
- Replaced DSG trans fluid (aka liquid gold)
- Dension lightning cable iPhone/android interface installed - works with factory system) https://www.dension.com/automotive/products/car-multimedia-solutions/gateway-lite) and steering wheel to play from phones and Spotify natively 
- Audi roof rack system and lock key
- Very dark tint
- New battery from Costco
- Recent oil/filter

The bad:
- The paint is faded on the hood
- A few little dents and scraps around the car
- Interior has wear, dash is a little rough
- Airbag light is on


All together this is a great city car that parks anywhere with ease, and with the rear camera it is a simple task. With the scraps already there, you don’t need to worry about the new ones. There was a previous accident before my ownership, but has zero impact on drivability or reliability - it was 100% fixed with a brand new radiator and AC condenser and fans. Being an original SF car paint and dash slightly faded UV. No issues all up to date on maintenance. I would keep this car but I have a little one on the way and it can’t fit the whole family. 

Feel free to ask any questions.

Hi all - selling my track-configured 2019 ND2 Miata. I purchased this car brand new in November 2018 and since then, it's evolved into a fully set up track car. Car has approx. ~11,350 miles. I'm selling since I just bought a F80 M3 and am finding I am no longer using this car. This car would be perfect for anyone looking to have a low cost car that they would like to track or if you'd like to invest a little bit more to convert to a full race car. The car has ~$20k just in parts for mods. This was the Club package w/ Brembo brakes. This car is registered in CA but airbags sensor is not plugged in - so buyer should trailer it home.

Please see the list of mods -- the top things I'd call out are:
-Car has no functional airbags due to installation of bucket seats/unplugging the sensor
-It's a custom 15" drivers seat from Kirkey, not everyone will fit. It should be easy to replace this & happy to inquire if needed

description:

1996 1.8 Mazda Miata for sale.
Car is race ready and has been racing in 24hr of lemons
Has completed 16 races to-date with 6 top 10 finishes.

The cost of the car is more to do what has been installed to make it race ready to compete in races such as a lemons if you want to start racing without having to put in a load of work into a car.

Miata car $500

Coil overs.
Performance manifold.
Sway bar.
Wheel spacers and flared arches.
Quick release steering wheel.
Racing seat and harness
Electrical kill switch
All items and install well over $3000.

The Car has just been serviced with all new filters, fluids, multipoint inspection.
Service and parts $1401

As the car has raced 16 times and has some cosmetic damage like wheel rubs and small dents.
There is no structural damage to the car.

If your looking to jump straight into a race ready, proven race car that can finish endurance racing then this is a perfect car.
For those that don’t know the cost/value of racing the breakdown has been provided to give an idea of the overall cost, which is well below the actual cost of turning a $500 car into a proven endurance race car.

title: Famous Colt 45 Mustang Fastback Funny Car #112233
description:
QR Code Link to This Post


Original Colt 45 Mustang Funny Car driven by famous race car driver Ezra Boggs. Own a piece of racing history.

General Information:
• We are a classic car dealership in Sherman, Texas and show by appointment only.
• Contact us at 903-820-1019.
• We buy, sell and trade classic vehicles. 
• Shipping is available (call for quote).

Exterior:
• Original Paint.
• 12 spoke spindle mounts in the front.
• 16 inch Halibrand Big Windows in the back.

Interior:
• Comes with a full vintage race suit and helmet.

Mechanical:
• Originally set up for a Chevy big block.

Miscellaneous:
Ezra Boggs was a funny car racer from Oklahoma. Boggs raced funny cars from coast to coast during the years 1969 to 1985. The first funny car Ezra raced was the Colt 45 machine of the Martin Brothers. The Martin Brothers were the third owners in the line of cars bearing the Colt 45 name. The first owners were the successful Ingram and Davis team out of California who built the first Colt 45 in 1966 to race in the NHRA AA/A class. The team then raced early funny cars with the blown steel body car. Davis and Ingram sold the car to Frank Reinauer, who bought the car to match race in the Oklahoma area.

Reinauer extended the front end 24 inches and replaced the small block with a 396 Chevy. The car never handled well so Reinauer had local funny car racers Gitthens and Allen build a new chassis from 2 x 4" square tubing. A new '69 Mustang body was ordered from Ron Pellegrini's Fiberglass, Ltd., shop outside Chicago. Frank drove the new car a couple of times but still did not like the feel of it. He sold the car to fellow Oklahomans Don and Jack Martin and Reinauer asked Ezra to drive the car for the new owners. Boggs drove the 480 cubic inch Chevy powered Mustang for two years with best times of 7.70 at 198 in 1970. (Photo courtesy of Ezra Boggs and www.mobydickaafc.com; info from Ezra Boggs and Draglist files)

• Sold with a bill of sale NO title.

title: 1983 El Camino Project Car, Custom Everything
description:
QR Code Link to This Post


1983 El Camino for Sale.

This project is halfway completed but still needs a lot of work to get it finished.  I bought this car and am taking the motor and tranny out for my project. 

ENGINE, TRANNY, ENGINE CONTROL MODULE, tranny control module, RADIATOR, THROTTLE.

Original owner/builder took a 2006 GTO and gutted it.  The floor pan, firewall, dash in the El Camino is GTO.  All GTO parts for the 2006 GTO are included (dash, HVAC, carpet, seats, center consul, electrical body harness, etc).  

Frame was build by original owner.  It's a solid frame with independent suspension all around.  Includes a 2003 Mustang Cobra independent rear end.  Front suspension is out of a C-6 corvette.  Has rack and pinion installed.  He is an engineer and used CAD software to design the frame.  Parts were designed in software and cut out in water jet machine.  

Suspension, frame, brakes, brake lines are completed.  Body work is mostly completed except front nose.  

The original owner made molds for front nose, hood, and front inner fender wells.  Meaning you can use those molds to make the hood or front nose out of carbon fiber which was what the original wanted to do.   Front inner fenders are carbon fiber and already made.

All trim pieces are included from the original El Camino.  Same with glass.  

Wheels and front brakes are from a c-6 corvette.  Rear brakes are from the mustang.

I don't know everything about this car because there's a lot of details.  But if you have a question, ask.

If you don't like the look of the 1984 El Camino, you might be able to use the frame on a 1984 Monte Carlo.

Email your questions.
